intro: Hoffmannseggella × victoriacarolinae, commonly known as the hybrid holly, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its spiny, serrated leaves and small, bright red berries. The plant typically grows to a height of 3–6 feet and produces clusters of white flowers in the spring. Its botanical features include opposite leaf arrangement and persistent, showy fruits that provide winter interest. This species is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
